channel.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
channel.description:
All you need to know is that I'm starting a new project for Rune Scape, I'm not giving details into what the project is but I can assure you its big.
[For Sythe.org Post] I decided too come back to RS cheating because most of you aren't advancing whatsoever. All I see is recycled code being abused and not really amounting to anything. [End For Sythe.org Post]
I haven't done anything for Rune Scape in awhile so I need a programmer that is familiar with RS.
Requirements:
-Understands VB6 (greatly)
-Understands Packets
-Understands Memory
If I select you as a programmer, you will have access to new functions (I made) that are very advanced (Easily trick RS Macro Detection system). You will also have access to this project's Source Code, so you can reproduce it as you like.
This kind of project has never been done in VB6 before.

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @RANCID RANCID
item.description:
@RANCID wrote:

On another topic

hey rancid a while back ago I remember using a runescape classic bot I guess it was a colorclicker somewhere from I recall it to be zonehacks.com or w/e had your name on it I guess you made that huh?

Yup.

Read full topic
item.source: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @RANCID RANCID
item.description:
@RANCID wrote:

A shell call to route.exe would make an easy and effective connection redirection in the windows enviroment. Packet bots are always cool, making a working packet bot isn’t hard, making it not instantly detectable is. Good luck :-).

Read full topic
item.source: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Not really checked myself, but for what I’ve read, a synchronized pseudo-random number generator is used to make packet injection impossible without modifying the client code or decyphering the RSA packets (as the seed for this generator would be sent RSA encrypted). It is also said that this generator is used to lightly encrypt the op-code of each packet, which would indeed be very fast and make the parsing of the packets very hard, even if their structure doesn’t change weekly.

Read full topic
item.source: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“rs2crash, post:1, topic:85645”]I would like to say that a packet bot was made its code name is Chinese Bot it is written I believe in Delphi

the reason I believe you want someone who knows memory managment is to patch the IP in the java client to localhost so runescape client would connect to your pc you would basiclly than need to rely all the login packets and you will be able to inject custom packets.

the chinese bot modifys your HOSTS file to localhost rswhateverserver.com its pretty good way because patching ip in memory of a java client would possibly get you detected but the HOSTS idea is not that good also because you would also need to make a listen socket for HTTP port to load up the website no problem than the runescape port will connect to your other listening port 43345 w/e i forgot

Yah its a fun project good for looking at bugs dupes not that good for autoing I already started something similar to this expect mines is kinda raw packet sending when it hooks Server Keys though… because it will just get patched like opcodes in packets change weekly that wouldnt be a problem though if you can RIP them in a perfect order from the java client every week but still very risky! and ya they wouldnt apply a heavy cipher to the game packets them self for 2000 players per server very heavy bandwidth would have to be encrypted/decrypted at fast speeds.[/quote]

It’s easier just to hook winsock, watch for the connect() call and redirect it.

Read full topic

If an auto-updating feature is so easy to implement, why isn’t AutoRune still going strong?[/quote]
Because they couldn’t be fucked?

item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Lol, decrypting and encrypting packets as they come in and go out actively is relatively simple. Identifying packets is another point of relavence, as mopar said the packet “id’s” change every week, however his statement that the structure changes every week is wrong at the very least.

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:24, topic:71483”][quote author=thiefmn6092 link=topic=105051.msg1057770#msg1057770 date=1175038089]

Let me guess - packet modifying bot?

Bad idea for so many reasons.

It looks like he plans to do something with memory too. Both of which in theory would work, and it would certainly put you in a powerful position. But keeping it working and up to date every week would be a huge challenge I would think.

Who knows? Mabey he knows something nobody else does aye.
[/quote]
virtualmaster and I are doing a packet bot.[/quote]

Good look with that… >_>

Read full topic

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:22, topic:71483”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=105051.msg1067517#msg1067517 date=1175316326]
Without even looking at the packets ask yourself a simple question:

If an auto-updating feature is so easy to implement, why isn’t AutoRune still going strong?
[/quote]

Lack of “motorvashun” from the more…competent members, as with private servers?[/quote]

It has much more to do with the fact that these days that is a very inefficient design for a bot.
However, good luck with the project anyway, I’d like to see it when it’s done regardless.

Read full topic

item.title: New VB6 Project (For Rune Scape) - Looking for experienced vb6 programmer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

terrankiller:

Packets being sent to the client via the server.

There’s hardly any encryption there, like Mopar said, pretty much just the login packet. I was just wondering if you’d actually looked at the communication between client and server yet? Because maintaining a bot like this is going to be much much harder than you imagine (to the point where you might as well just write a client modification instead).

Read full topic
